dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Hey, wanna chat about the BBC?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Sure!  I do not know a great deal about the channel but would definitely love to learn more!

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: No worries, it's a UK thing! So, the BBC is actually the world's oldest national broadcasting organisation, pretty cool right?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Oh wow I did not realize it was the oldest.  That is very interesting.  What year did it debut in?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Don't worry, I didn't know the exact year either! But I can tell you it's been around since 1922, can you believe it?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Wow that's very surprising.  And it is still going strong today I take it?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, it's still one of the biggest broadcasters in the world, with over 20,000 staff members, and it's still funded by a TV licence fee paid by households in the UK!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: That is great.  Would you say the organization tends to lean more to the right or to the left?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Honestly, the BBC's supposed to be impartial, but there's always some debate about that! Officially, it's meant to be neutral, but some people think it leans a bit left, while others think it's too right-wing.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I see.  I think it is referenced in a song done by Mike Meyers in the Austin Powers series if I am not mistaken.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, that's right! Mike Myers does a funny sketch as a BBC news anchor in one of the Austin Powers movies, it's a classic!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Now if I recall in a song he sings he references BBC1 and BBC2 and perhaps some more.  What is this reference regarding?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You're thinking of the song "Soul Bossa Nova"! Mike Myers sings about watching BBC1 and BBC2, which are actually two of the BBC's main TV channels in the UK!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Ok so there are more than one channel.  Interesting.  Silly song and silly that this is where the conversation has gone!

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I know, right? Who knew a conversation about the BBC would end up in Austin Powers territory? But hey, it's been a fun detour!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It definitely is.  Would you say there is someone who is the "face" of BBC?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You know, the BBC has had a lot of iconic presenters over the years, but one person who's often considered the "face" of the BBC is Sir David Attenborough! He's a legendary naturalist and broadcaster who's been with the BBC for decades, and he's still going strong!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I have heard of him.  Is it possible to watch BBC here in the United States?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, you can definitely watch BBC in the US! They have a bunch of shows that air on PBS, and you can also stream BBC content on services like Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime. Plus, they have their own streaming service, BritBox, that's specifically for British TV shows!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I am definitely going to have to check it out!

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You should! They have some amazing shows, like Doctor Who, Sherlock, and Downton Abbey. And if you're interested in news, they have BBC News America that's available in the US too!
